intro: Pimelea sessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved geebung, is a small shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its narrow, often hairy leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and heathland environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Pimelea sessilis is often found in open habitats and is relatively resilient to environmental stress.
